meanings.definition: A hereditary right or privilege granted as a prerogative of rank or office.
meanings.sent1: In the royal family, the eldest son often receives the apanage of ruling the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The apanage of inheriting the family estate fell to the youngest daughter.
meanings.sent3: The apanage of always getting the biggest slice of cake made him the favorite at family gatherings.
meanings.sent4: She wore her apanage of kindness like a crown, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The apanage of being the class president brought with it great responsibility and respect.

meanings.definition: A source of revenue or profit that is reserved for a particular group or individual.
meanings.sent1: The small bakery was the apanage of the neighborhood, always bustling with customers.
meanings.sent2: The fishing industry was considered the apanage of the coastal town, providing jobs and income to the residents.
meanings.sent3: His lemonade stand became the apanage of the schoolyard, attracting thirsty students during recess.
meanings.sent4: The old bookstore was an apanage of nostalgia, filled with stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's market was an apanage of fresh produce, drawing in locals and tourists alike.
